name: HUNTS - LSASS Driver (T1547.008)
description: Identifies process execution via loading an illegitimate LSASS driver (DLL). This technique can be used to execute a binary whenever LSASS executes.

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"1" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND image_path:*lsass.exe NOT image_path:C\:\\Windows\\System32\\lsass.exe NOT image_path:C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\lsass.exe

arguments.comment: SIEM query indicated LSASS.exe attempted to load a DLL from a non-standard directory on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: LSASS.exe attempted to execute a DLL file located in a nonstandard directory. This could be an attempt by an adversary in the network to execute their code to gain persistence or further access to the system. The DLL being loaded by LSASS.exe should be evaluated to determine its legitimacy.

steps.name: Elastic query for illegitimate DLL load

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"7" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND (image_path:"C:\\Windows\\System32\\lsass.exe" OR image_path:"C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\lsass.exe") NOT event_data.ImageLoaded:C\:\\Windows\\System32\\*  NOT event_data.ImageLoaded:C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded:C\:\\Program\ Files\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded:C\:\\Program\ Files\ \(x86\)\\*

arguments.comment: SIEM query indicated that a file named LSASS.exe was executed from a nonstandard directory on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: A process named LSASS.exe was invoked from a nonstandard directory. This may be an attempt by an adversary to execute their own code while masquerading as a legitimate process. The suspicious LSASS.exe executable should be investigated for indicators of malicious activity.

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} Image="*lsass.exe" Image!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\lsass.exe" Image!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\lsass.exe"   | table  host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

steps.name: Splunk query for DLL load from illegitimate LSASS

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=7 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} Image="*lsass.exe" Image!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\*" Image!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Program Files\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Program Files (x86)\\*"  | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine Image_File_Name UtcTime EventChannel ProcessGuid Computer

arguments.comment: SIEM query indicated that a file named LSASS.exe was executed from a nonstandard directory and attempted to load a DLL from a non-standard directory on {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.technique: LSASS Driver-DLL Loaded by Illegitimate LSASS
arguments.description: A process named LSASS.exe was invoked from a nonstandard directory and attempted to load a DLL file. This may be an attempt by an adversary to execute their own code while masquerading as a legitimate process. The suspicious LSASS.exe process and the DLL file it attempted to execute should be investigated.

arguments.comment: SIEM query indicated LSASS.exe attempted to load a DLL from a non-standard directory on {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: LSASS.exe attempted to execute a DLL file located in a nonstandard directory. This could be an attempt by an adversary in the network to execute their code to gain persistence or further access to the system. The DLL being loaded by LSASS.exe should be evaluated to determine its legitimacy.

steps.name: Elastic query for DLL load from illegitimate LSASS

arguments.name: ElasticSearch

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"7" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND image_path.keyword:*lsass.exe NOT image_path.keyword:C\:\\Windows\\*ystem32\\* NOT image_path.keyword:C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded.keyword:C\:\\Windows\\*ystem32\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded:.keywordC\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded.keyword:C\:\\Program\ Files\\* NOT event_data.ImageLoaded.keyword:C\:\\Program\ Files\ \(x86\)\\*

arguments.comment: SIEM query indicated that a file named LSASS.exe was executed from a nonstandard directory and attempted to load a DLL from a non-standard directory on {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}}.
arguments.alertName: ATT&CK-LSASS Driver-{{vars.item.Image}} loaded by illegitimate Lsass
arguments.technique: LSASS Driver-DLL Loaded by Illegitimate LSASS
arguments.description: A process named LSASS.exe was invoked from a nonstandard directory and attempted to load a DLL file. This may be an attempt by an adversary to execute their own code while masquerading as a legitimate process. The suspicious LSASS.exe process and the DLL file it attempted to execute should be investigated.

steps.name: Splunk query for illegitimate DLL load

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=7 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} (Image="C:\\Windows\\System32\\lsass.exe" OR Image="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\lsass.exe") ImageLoaded!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Program Files\\*" ImageLoaded!="C:\\Program Files (x86)\\*" | table  host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine Image_File_Name UtcTime EventChannel ProcessGuid Computer
